metadata.titleEn: Daily cloud-free MODIS NDSI and snow phenology dataset over High Mountain Asia （2000-2021）
metadata.titleCn: 亚洲高山区逐日无云MODIS 积雪指数（NDSI）与积雪物候数据集（2000-2021）
metadata.description:
Snow cover is an important component of the cryosphere and an indispensable variable in the scientific research of global change and Earth system. The distribution range and phenological information of snow cover are important indicators to measure the variation characteristics of snow cover, and also important parameters for snow melting runoff simulation in the hydrological model of cold regions. The  High Mountain Asia is the source of many international rivers, and also the hot spot of global climate change research; The ecological and environmental problems caused by the change of ice and snow in the region, such as the reduction of water resources, the increase of extreme weather events, and the frequent occurrence of disasters, have attracted extensive attention from all countries. Therefore, it is very important for climate change research, water resources management, disaster early warning and prevention to accurately obtain long-term snow distribution and snow phenology data in  High Mountain Asia .
The daily cloudless MODIS normalized snow cover index (NDSI) product (2000-2021500 m) in the High Mountain Asia is based on the MODIS daily snow cover product (including Terra Morning Star data product MOD10A1 and Aqua Afternoon Star data product MYD10A1, C6 versions), and is processed by the same day afternoon star data fusion and cubic spline interpolation cloud removal algorithm; Among them, when there was only Morningstar data product MOD10A1 from 2000 to 2002, the cubic spline interpolation algorithm was directly used for cloud removal. The snow cover phenological data set for hydrological years 2002-2020 is prepared based on cloudless MODIS NDSI products in hydrological years, including three parameters:  snow onset date (SOD), snow end date (SED) and  snow duration days (SDD). This data set has reliable accuracy.
metadata.descriptionCn:
积雪是冰冻圈的重要组成要素，是全球变化与地球系统科学研究中不可或缺的变量。积雪的分布范围和物候信息是衡量积雪变化特征的重要指标，也是寒区水文模型中融雪径流模拟的重要参数。亚洲高山区是许多国际性河流的发源地，也是全球气候变化研究的热点区；该地区冰雪变化将引发的水资源减少、极端天气事件增多、灾害频发等生态和环境问题，已受到各国的广泛关注。因此，准确获取长时序的亚洲高山区积雪分布与积雪物候数据对气候变化研究、水资源管理以及灾害预警与防治至关重要。
亚洲高山区逐日无云MODIS归一化积雪指数（NDSI）产品（2000-2021，500 m）是在MODIS逐日积雪产品（包括Terra上午星数据产品MOD10A1和Aqua下午星数据产品MYD10A1，C6版本）的基础上，通过同一天上下午星数据融合以及三次样条函数插值去云算法处理后得到；其中，在2000-2002年只有上午星数据产品MOD10A1时，则直接采用三次样条函数插值去云算法处理。水文年2002-2020的积雪物候数据集是基于逐水文年内的无云MODIS NDSI产品制备而成，包括积雪开始日期（SOD）、积雪结束日期（SED）和积雪持续日数（SDD）3个参数。本数据集具有可靠的精度。
metadata.instructions:
MODIS NDSI data name: YYYYddd_ HMA_ MODIS_ NDSI_ 0.5km.img, where YYYY represents the year and ddd represents Julian day (001-365/366); Example: 2021009_ HMA_ MODIS_ NDSI_ 0.5km.img refers to MODIS NDSI products with a spatial resolution of 0.5km in the High Mountain Asia on January 9, 2021.
Name of snow cover phenological data: YYYY_ HMA_ MODIS_ SOD/SED/SDD_ 0.5km. Tif, where YYYY represents the year, SOD is the snow onset date, SED is the snow end date, and SDD is the  snow duration days ; For example: 2020_ HMA_ MODIS_ SOD_ 0.5km.tif refers to the MODIS snow onset date of the Asian alpine region in 2020 hydrological year (2020/9/1 to 2021/8/31) with a spatial resolution of 0.5km.
The file can be opened and viewed by ENVI or ARCGIS and other software.
metadata.instructionsCn:
MODIS NDSI 数据命名：YYYYddd_HMA_MODIS_NDSI_0.5km.img，其中YYYY代表年，ddd代表儒略日（001-365/366）；例如：2021009_HMA_MODIS_NDSI_0.5km.img，表示亚洲高山区2021年1月9日，空间分辨率为0.5km的MODIS NDSI产品。
积雪物候数据命名：YYYY_HMA_MODIS_SOD/SED/SDD_0.5km.tif，其中YYYY代表水文年，SOD为积雪开始日期，SED为积雪结束日期，SDD为积雪持续日数；例如：2020_HMA_MODIS_SOD_0.5km.tif，表示亚洲高山区2020水文年（2020/9/1至2021/8/31），空间分辨率为0.5km的MODIS 积雪开始日期数据。
文件可用ENVI或者ARCGIS等软件打开查看。

background: Snow cover is a critical component of both the global energy and water cycles, covering about 40 to 50 % of the northern hemisphere during winter. Due to its high albedo and high emissivity as well as low thermal conductivity, snow cover has a large-scale cooling effect on the global climate system through strong interaction with the surface energy budget. Seasonal snow cover in high latitude and altitude regions in the northern and southern hemispheres is very sensitive to climate change. In this climate change context, the snow-covered extent (SCE) in the Northern Hemisphere has undergone significant reductions over the past decades and this trend will continue. HMA is the third largest cryosphere on earth outside of the Earth’s polar regions, known as the third pole of the earth, the birthplace of many great rivers, known as "Water Tower of Asia". As one of the most sensitive and prominent regions responding to global climate changes, HMA has experienced a considerable warming trend and the components of cryosphere (such as snow cover and glaciers) have been rapid shrinking over the last decades. Impacts of climate change on the cryosphere strongly led to changes in mountainous hydrological processes and water resources, and increased the HMA’s runoff due to the accelerated glacier/snowmelt.
research objective: The focus of this study is the detection and exhaustive analysis of spatiotemporal variability of the latest snow cover and snow phenology over HMA. Using the daily cloud-free MODIS snow cover products, the main objectives of this study are to (1) extract the snow cover parameters (SCE, SCD, SOD, SED and SDD) and analyse their spatiotemporal variations; (2) reveal the vertical difference of the relation of elevation to snow phenology; (3) to investigate the potential influence of climate factors on snow phenology variations.
challenges: The extensive cloud cover over snow-covered region is a critical issue that greatly limits the applications of the MODIS snow cover product to monitor the snow cover. The inconsistency between study region, time frame, and scale makes it a challenge for understanding where and how snow cover is changing.
methods: In this study, the same cloud-gap-filling strategy is used with the addition of the combination of MOD10A1 and MYD10A1 for the daily cloud-free MODIS NDSI product generation from 2002 to 2021. The SCD is calculated as the number of days a pixel is covered by snow in a hydrological year. During a hydrological year, the SOD is defined as the first date of the first five continuous snow cover days; the SED is defined as the last date of the last five continuous snow cover days; the SDD is defined as the duration days from SOD to SED.
dataset: The MODIS Terra and MODIS Aqua daily snow cover products (MOD10A1 and MYD10A1, Version C6) during 2002 – 2021 from NASA’s EOSDIS “Earthdata” are utilized in this study. The daily SD observed by 44 meteorological stations during 2002 – 2013 are used to extract the ground-observed snow phenology and are employed as ground truth to verify the performance of the snow phenology retrieved by daily cloud-free MODIS NDSI product.
findings: The results indicate that the monthly SCE over the whole HMA exhibited a slight decreasing in most months over the study period. The variability of snow cover and snow phenology over the whole HMA generally showed decreased SCD (significant decrease accounts for 15.73%), delayed SOD (significant delay accounts for 14.35%), advanced SED (significant advance accounts for 15.46%) and shortened SDD (significant shorten accounts for 16.01%). There is an elevation dependence of snow phenology changes over HMA with the high-altitude mountain ranges generally having a higher SCD, earlier SOD, later SED and longer SDD than low altitude areas. The air temperature of snow accumulation period is the dominant factor affecting the interannual variation of SOD, and the air temperature of snow melt period is the dominant factor affecting the interannual variation of SED. The increase of air temperature leads to the delayed SOD, advanced SED and shortened SDD.
backgroundCn: 雪盖是全球能量和水循环的关键组成部分，在冬季覆盖北半球约40%到50%的区域。由于其高反射率、高发射率以及低导热性，雪盖通过与地表能量预算的强相互作用，对全球气候系统产生了大规模的冷却效应。北半球高纬度和高海拔地区的季节性雪盖对气候变化非常敏感。在气候变化的背景下，北半球的雪覆盖范围（SCE）在过去几十年中经历了显著减少，这一趋势将持续下去。喜马拉雅-高山地区（HMA）是地球上第三大冰冻圈，位于地球极地之外，被称为地球的第三极，是许多大河的发源地，被誉为“亚洲水塔”。作为对全球气候变化反应最敏感和显著的地区之一，HMA在过去几十年中经历了显著的变暖趋势，冰冻圈的组成部分（如雪盖和冰川）迅速缩小。气候变化对冰冻圈的影响强烈导致了山区水文过程和水资源的变化，并因加速的冰川/雪融化而增加了HMA的径流。
research objectiveCn: 本研究的重点是检测和全面分析HMA地区最新的雪盖和雪物候的时空变异性。利用每日无云的MODIS雪盖产品，本研究的主要目标是：(1) 提取雪盖参数（SCE、SCD、SOD、SED和SDD）并分析其时空变化；(2) 揭示海拔对雪物候关系的垂直差异；(3) 研究气候因素对雪物候变化的潜在影响。
challengesCn: 广泛的云层覆盖在雪覆盖区域是一个关键问题，极大地限制了MODIS雪盖产品监测雪盖的应用。研究区域、时间框架和尺度之间的不一致使得理解雪盖变化的地点和方式变得具有挑战性。
methodsCn: 在本研究中，采用相同的云缺失填补策略，并结合MOD10A1和MYD10A1生成2002年至2021年的每日无云MODIS NDSI产品。SCD被计算为一个水文年内像素被雪覆盖的天数。在一个水文年内，SOD定义为连续五天雪覆盖的第一天；SED定义为连续五天雪覆盖的最后一天；SDD定义为从SOD到SED的持续天数。
datasetCn: 本研究利用NASA的EOSDIS“Earthdata”中MODIS Terra和MODIS Aqua的日雪盖产品（MOD10A1和MYD10A1，版本C6）在2002年至2021年期间的数据。2002年至2013年期间，44个气象站观测的日降雪深度（SD）用于提取地面观测的雪相，并作为地面真相验证通过日云-free MODIS NDSI产品提取的雪相性能。
findingsCn: 结果表明，在整个高山地区（HMA），月度雪覆盖面积（SCE）在研究期间的大多数月份呈现出轻微下降的趋势。整个高山地区的雪覆盖和雪相现象的变异性普遍表现为雪覆盖天数（SCD）减少（显著减少占15.73%）、雪开始日期（SOD）延迟（显著延迟占14.35%）、雪结束日期（SED）提前（显著提前占15.46%）以及雪持续天数（SDD）缩短（显著缩短占16.01%）。雪相变化在高山地区表现出海拔依赖性，高海拔山脉通常具有更高的雪覆盖天数、更早的雪开始日期、更晚的雪结束日期和更长的雪持续天数，低海拔地区则相反。雪积累期的气温是影响雪开始日期年际变化的主导因素，而雪融化期的气温是影响雪结束日期年际变化的主导因素。气温的升高导致雪开始日期延迟、雪结束日期提前和雪持续天数缩短。

Verification.QuestionEn: Do the MODIS Terra and Aqua daily snow cover products include parameters such as SOD, SED, and SDD for snow phenology analysis?
Verification.QuestionCn: MODIS Terra和Aqua的每日雪盖产品是否包含用于雪相分析的参数，如SOD、SED和SDD？

Verification.QuestionEn: Is the extensive cloud cover over snow-covered regions a critical issue for applying MODIS snow cover products?
Verification.QuestionCn: 广泛的云层覆盖在雪覆盖区域是否对应用MODIS雪覆盖产品构成关键问题？

Disjunctive.QuestionEn: Which data fusion technique is more suitable for generating daily cloud-free snow cover products in high-altitude regions, MODIS Terra and Aqua combination, or another method?
Disjunctive.QuestionCn: 哪种数据融合技术更适合在高海拔地区生成每日无云雪盖产品，MODIS Terra和Aqua的组合，还是其他方法？
Disjunctive.AnswerCn: MODIS Terra 和 Aqua 组合

Disjunctive.QuestionEn: For ground truth verification of snow phenology data, are meteorological station observations or satellite data more commonly used?
Disjunctive.QuestionCn: 对于雪相数据的真实情况验证，气象站观测数据还是卫星数据更常被使用？

Concept Completion.QuestionEn: What methods are used to generate daily cloud-free MODIS NDSI products for snow cover analysis?
Concept Completion.QuestionCn: 用于生成每日无云MODIS NDSI产品以进行雪盖分析的方法有哪些？

Concept Completion.QuestionEn: Where are the meteorological stations located that provide ground-truth data for snow phenology validation?
Concept Completion.QuestionCn: 提供雪相验证的地面真实数据的气象站位于哪里？

Concept Completion.QuestionEn: What challenges are associated with using MODIS snow cover products for monitoring snow cover in high-altitude areas?
Concept Completion.QuestionCn: 使用MODIS雪盖产品监测高海拔地区雪盖时面临的挑战有哪些？

Example.QuestionEn: Can you provide an example of a data collection method used to obtain cloud-free snow cover information in high-altitude regions?
Example.QuestionCn: 您能否提供一个用于获取高海拔地区无云雪盖信息的数据收集方法的示例？
Example.AnswerEn: An example of a data collection method is the use of a cloud-gap-filling strategy that combines the MOD10A1 and MYD10A1 products to generate daily cloud-free MODIS NDSI products for high-altitude regions from 2002 to 2021.
Example.AnswerCn: 一种数据收集方法是使用云缺失填补策略，结合MOD10A1和MYD10A1产品，生成2002年至2021年高海拔地区的每日无云MODIS NDSI产品。

Example.QuestionEn: What is an example of a challenge faced when using satellite data for snow cover monitoring in mountainous regions?
Example.QuestionCn: 在山区使用卫星数据进行雪盖监测时面临的一个挑战是什么？
Example.AnswerEn: A common challenge is the extensive cloud cover over snow-covered regions, which significantly limits the application of MODIS snow cover products for monitoring purposes.
Example.AnswerCn: 一个常见的挑战是雪覆盖区域的广泛云层，这显著限制了MODIS雪覆盖产品在监测方面的应用。

Example.QuestionEn: Could you provide an example of a dataset that serves as ground truth for validating satellite-derived snow phenology data?
Example.QuestionCn: 您能否提供一个数据集的示例，该数据集作为验证卫星衍生雪相数据的真实情况？
Example.AnswerEn: An example of such a dataset is the daily snow depth observed by 44 meteorological stations during 2002 – 2013, which is used to extract ground-observed snow phenology and verify the performance of snow phenology retrieved by daily cloud-free MODIS NDSI products.
Example.AnswerCn: 这样的数据集的一个例子是2002年至2013年期间由44个气象站观测的每日雪深，用于提取地面观测的雪相并验证通过每日无云MODIS NDSI产品获取的雪相的性能。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What are the characteristics or features that make the MODIS NDSI product suitable for snow cover monitoring in high-altitude Asian regions?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: MODIS NDSI产品适合在高海拔亚洲地区进行雪盖监测的特征或特点有哪些？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: daily cloud-free snow cover data, combination of MOD10A1 and MYD10A1 products, cloud-gap-filling strategy
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 每日无云雪盖数据，结合MOD10A1和MYD10A1产品，云间隙填充策略。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What attributes of snow phenology are critical for understanding its spatiotemporal variability in high mountain Asian regions?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 理解高山亚洲地区雪相变异的时空变化，哪些雪相特征是关键的？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: snow cover extent, snow cover duration, snow onset date, snow end date, snow duration days
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 积雪覆盖范围、积雪覆盖持续时间、积雪开始日期、积雪结束日期、积雪持续天数

Quantification.QuestionEn: How many days of cloud-free snow cover data were generated using the cloud-gap-filling strategy in the data collection method?
Quantification.QuestionCn: 使用云间隙填充策略生成了多少天的无云雪覆盖数据？

Quantification.QuestionEn: How many meteorological stations provided ground-observed snow phenology data for verification?
Quantification.QuestionCn: 有多少个气象站提供了地面观测的雪相数据用于验证？

Definition.QuestionEn: What is the significance of 'cloud-free MODIS snow cover products' in snow cover data collection?
Definition.QuestionCn: “无云MODIS雪盖产品”在雪盖数据收集中的重要性是什么？
Definition.AnswerEn: Cloud-free MODIS snow cover products refer to data that have been processed to remove the influence of clouds, which can obscure snow cover in satellite images. This processing is crucial because extensive cloud cover greatly limits the applications of the MODIS snow cover product for monitoring snow cover. By using a cloud-gap-filling strategy and combining data from MOD10A1 and MYD10A1, researchers can generate daily cloud-free MODIS NDSI products, improving the accuracy and reliability of snow cover monitoring.
Definition.AnswerCn: 无云MODIS雪盖产品是指经过处理以去除云层影响的数据，因为云层会遮挡卫星图像中的雪盖。这种处理至关重要，因为广泛的云层覆盖大大限制了MODIS雪盖产品在监测雪盖方面的应用。通过使用云缺口填补策略，并结合MOD10A1和MYD10A1的数据，研究人员可以生成每日无云MODIS NDSI产品，从而提高雪盖监测的准确性和可靠性。

Definition.QuestionEn: What does 'snow phenology' mean in the context of high mountain Asia (HMA) research?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在高山亚洲（HMA）研究的背景下，“雪物候学”是什么意思？
Definition.AnswerEn: Snow phenology refers to the study of seasonal patterns and timing of snow cover, including parameters such as the snow cover extent (SCE), snow cover duration (SCD), snow onset date (SOD), snow end date (SED), and snow duration days (SDD). This involves analyzing the spatiotemporal variations of snow cover and understanding how these are influenced by factors such as elevation and climate change, particularly in sensitive regions like high mountain Asia (HMA).
Definition.AnswerCn: 雪相位学是指研究雪覆盖的季节性模式和时序，包括雪覆盖范围（SCE）、雪覆盖持续时间（SCD）、雪开始日期（SOD）、雪结束日期（SED）和雪持续天数（SDD）等参数。这涉及分析雪覆盖的时空变化，并理解这些变化如何受到海拔和气候变化等因素的影响，特别是在高山亚洲（HMA）等敏感地区。

Comparison.QuestionEn: How do the data collection techniques used in generating daily cloud-free MODIS NDSI products compare to those used in collecting ground-observed snow phenology data from meteorological stations?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 生成每日无云MODIS NDSI产品的数据收集技术与从气象站收集的地面观测雪相数据所使用的技术相比，如何？
Comparison.AnswerEn: The daily cloud-free MODIS NDSI products are generated using a combination of MOD10A1 and MYD10A1 data and a cloud-gap-filling strategy from satellite observations, whereas ground-observed snow phenology data are collected from meteorological stations that directly observe snow depth, providing ground truth for validation.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 每日无云的MODIS NDSI产品是通过结合MOD10A1和MYD10A1数据以及来自卫星观测的云缺口填补策略生成的，而地面观测的雪相数据则是从直接观察雪深的气象站收集的，为验证提供了地面真相。

Comparison.QuestionEn: How does the spatiotemporal variability analysis of snow phenology using MODIS data compare to that using ground-based data in terms of resolution and accuracy?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 使用MODIS数据进行雪相变异性分析的时空变异性与使用地面数据相比，在分辨率和准确性方面如何？
Comparison.AnswerEn: MODIS data allows for a broad spatiotemporal analysis with high resolution over large areas, capturing variability in snow phenology across diverse terrains, but may require interpolation techniques to address cloud cover gaps. Ground-based data provides high accuracy at specific locations, serving as a reliable reference for validating satellite-derived snow phenology.
Comparison.AnswerCn: MODIS数据允许对大范围区域进行广泛的时空分析，能够捕捉不同地形中雪相的变化，但可能需要插值技术来处理云层覆盖造成的缺口。基于地面的数据在特定地点提供高精度，作为验证卫星衍生雪相的可靠参考。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: How can the combination of MODIS Terra and Aqua daily snow cover products enhance the accuracy of snow phenology data collection in high-altitude regions?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: MODIS Terra和Aqua每日雪盖产品的结合如何提高高海拔地区雪相数据收集的准确性？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: The combination of MODIS Terra and Aqua daily snow cover products allows for the creation of daily cloud-free MODIS NDSI products. This method uses data from both morning (Terra) and afternoon (Aqua) satellites, along with a cloud-gap-filling strategy, to ensure more comprehensive and accurate snow cover observations, crucial for high-altitude regions where cloud cover can otherwise impede data collection.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: MODIS Terra和Aqua每日雪盖产品的结合可以创建每日无云的MODIS NDSI产品。这种方法利用早晨（Terra）和下午（Aqua）卫星的数据，以及云间隙填补策略，以确保更全面和准确的雪盖观测，这对于高海拔地区尤为重要，因为云层覆盖可能会妨碍数据收集。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What challenges arise from using MODIS data products for monitoring snow cover and how might these affect the interpretation of snow phenology patterns?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 使用MODIS数据产品监测雪盖时会出现哪些挑战，这些挑战可能如何影响雪相模式的解释？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: A major challenge is the extensive cloud cover over snow-covered regions, which limits the application of MODIS snow cover products for accurate monitoring. This can affect the interpretation of snow phenology patterns by introducing inconsistencies in data coverage and temporal resolution, potentially skewing the understanding of snow cover changes in terms of spatial and temporal variations.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 一个主要挑战是雪覆盖区域的广泛云层，这限制了MODIS雪覆盖产品的应用，影响了准确监测。这可能会通过引入数据覆盖和时间分辨率的不一致性，影响对雪相现象模式的解释，从而可能扭曲对雪覆盖变化在空间和时间变化方面的理解。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What role does elevation play in the interpretation of snow phenology changes, and how can data collection methods be adapted to account for these variations?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 海拔在雪相变化的解读中扮演着什么角色，数据收集方法如何适应这些变化？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Elevation plays a significant role in snow phenology changes, with high-altitude areas generally exhibiting higher SCD, earlier SOD, later SED, and longer SDD compared to lower altitudes. Data collection methods can be adapted by incorporating elevation-specific analysis to account for these variations, ensuring that the influence of altitude on snow cover dynamics is accurately captured and interpreted.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 海拔在雪相现象变化中起着重要作用，高海拔地区通常表现出更高的雪覆盖持续时间（SCD）、更早的雪开始日期（SOD）、更晚的雪结束日期（SED）以及比低海拔地区更长的雪覆盖持续天数（SDD）。数据收集方法可以通过纳入特定海拔的分析来进行调整，以考虑这些变化，确保准确捕捉和解释海拔对雪盖动态的影响。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What causes the challenges associated with the use of MODIS snow cover products for monitoring snow cover in the Asian high mountains?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 导致在亚洲高山地区使用MODIS雪盖产品监测雪盖时面临挑战的原因是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The extensive cloud cover over snow-covered regions is a critical issue that greatly limits the applications of the MODIS snow cover product to monitor the snow cover.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 广泛的云层覆盖在积雪地区是一个关键问题，极大地限制了MODIS雪盖产品监测雪盖的应用。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why is it challenging to understand where and how snow cover is changing in the Asian high mountains?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 为什么很难理解亚洲高山地区的积雪覆盖在哪里以及如何变化？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The inconsistency between study region, time frame, and scale makes it a challenge for understanding where and how snow cover is changing.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 研究区域、时间框架和尺度之间的不一致性使得理解雪盖变化的地点和方式变得具有挑战性。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the potential consequences of using a cloud-gap-filling strategy on the accuracy and reliability of snow cover and snow phenology data in high-altitude regions?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 在高海拔地区使用云缺口填充策略对雪盖和雪物候数据的准确性和可靠性可能产生的后果是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: The use of a cloud-gap-filling strategy, combined with data from MODIS Terra and Aqua, allows for the generation of daily cloud-free MODIS NDSI products, which can enhance the accuracy and reliability of snow phenology data in high-altitude regions. This method mitigates issues related to extensive cloud cover, enhancing the monitoring capabilities of snow cover changes.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 使用云-gap-filling策略，结合MODIS Terra和Aqua的数据，可以生成每日无云的MODIS NDSI产品，从而提高高海拔地区雪相数据的准确性和可靠性。这种方法减轻了广泛云层覆盖带来的问题，增强了对雪盖变化监测的能力。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What is the primary intention behind utilizing daily cloud-free MODIS NDSI products for snow cover analysis in the Asian high mountains?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 利用每日无云MODIS NDSI产品进行亚洲高山地区雪盖分析的主要意图是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The main objectives of using daily cloud-free MODIS snow cover products are to extract snow cover parameters and analyze their spatiotemporal variations, reveal the relation of snow phenology to elevation, and investigate the potential influence of climate factors on snow phenology variations over the High Mountain Asia (HMA) region.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 使用每日无云MODIS雪盖产品的主要目标是提取雪盖参数并分析其时空变化，揭示雪相与海拔的关系，以及研究气候因素对高山亚洲（HMA）地区雪相变化的潜在影响。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it important to address the challenges of cloud cover when monitoring snow cover using remote sensing techniques?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 为什么在使用遥感技术监测积雪时解决云层问题很重要？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: Extensive cloud cover over snow-covered regions is a critical issue that limits the application of MODIS snow cover products for monitoring. Addressing this challenge is crucial for understanding snow cover changes across different regions and time frames, which is essential for accurate climate change research and water resource management.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 广泛的云层覆盖在雪覆盖区域是一个关键问题，限制了MODIS雪覆盖产品的应用以进行监测。解决这一挑战对于理解不同区域和时间框架内的雪覆盖变化至关重要，这对准确的气候变化研究和水资源管理至关重要。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What are the goals of integrating ground-based meteorological data with remote sensing data in snow phenology studies?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在雪相研究中，将地面气象数据与遥感数据集成的目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The goal of integrating ground-based meteorological data with remote sensing data is to verify the performance of snow phenology retrieved by remote sensing products. This integration helps in extracting ground-observed snow phenology, which serves as ground truth, enhancing the reliability and accuracy of snow phenology assessments over the study area.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 将地面气象数据与遥感数据集成的目标是验证遥感产品获取的雪相现象的表现。这种集成有助于提取地面观测的雪相现象，作为地面真相，从而提高研究区域内雪相现象评估的可靠性和准确性。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What procedures are involved in generating a cloud-free MODIS NDSI product for monitoring snow cover in high-altitude Asian regions?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 生成用于监测高海拔亚洲地区雪盖的无云MODIS NDSI产品涉及哪些程序？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The process involves using a cloud-gap-filling strategy that combines data from MOD10A1 and MYD10A1 products. The data fusion is done for the same day from the Terra and Aqua satellites, followed by the application of a cubic spline interpolation algorithm to remove cloud cover, generating a cloud-free daily MODIS NDSI product from 2002 to 2021.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 该过程涉及使用云缺失填补策略，结合MOD10A1和MYD10A1产品的数据。数据融合是在同一天从Terra和Aqua卫星获取的，随后应用三次样条插值算法去除云覆盖，生成2002年至2021年的无云每日MODIS NDSI产品。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: How can the spatiotemporal variability of snow cover parameters be effectively analyzed using satellite data in the context of climate change research?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 如何在气候变化研究的背景下有效分析卫星数据中雪盖参数的时空变异性？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The analysis can be conducted by extracting snow cover parameters such as snow-covered extent (SCE), snow cover duration (SCD), snow onset date (SOD), snow end date (SED), and snow duration days (SDD) from the daily cloud-free MODIS snow cover products. These parameters are then evaluated for their spatiotemporal variations and related to elevation differences and climate factors.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 分析可以通过提取雪盖参数，如雪覆盖范围（SCE）、雪盖持续时间（SCD）、雪开始日期（SOD）、雪结束日期（SED）和雪持续天数（SDD），从每日无云的MODIS雪盖产品中进行。这些参数随后被评估其时空变化，并与海拔差异和气候因素相关联。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What methodologies are used to verify the accuracy of snow phenology data extracted from satellite imagery in high mountain regions?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 用于验证高山地区从卫星影像提取的雪相数据准确性的 methodologies 有哪些？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The verification process involves comparing the snow phenology data retrieved from the daily cloud-free MODIS NDSI product with ground-observed snow phenology data. This ground truth data is obtained from the daily snow depth observations recorded by 44 meteorological stations during the period from 2002 to 2013.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 验证过程涉及将从每日无云的MODIS NDSI产品中获取的雪相数据与地面观测的雪相数据进行比较。这些地面真实数据来自44个气象站在2002年至2013年期间记录的每日雪深观测。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What data integration techniques enable the generation of cloud-free snow cover datasets in high-altitude regions?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些数据集成技术能够生成高海拔地区的无云雪盖数据集？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The combination of MODIS Terra and Aqua daily snow cover products (MOD10A1 and MYD10A1) along with a cloud-gap-filling strategy and cubic spline interpolation are used to generate cloud-free MODIS NDSI products, enabling the study of snow cover in high-altitude regions.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 结合MODIS Terra和Aqua的每日雪盖产品（MOD10A1和MYD10A1），以及云缺口填补策略和三次样条插值，生成无云的MODIS NDSI产品，从而能够研究高海拔地区的雪盖情况。

Enablement.QuestionEn: How do meteorological station observations contribute to the validation of snow phenology datasets in challenging terrains?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 气象站观测如何在复杂地形中对雪相数据集的验证作出贡献？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Observations from meteorological stations are used to extract ground-observed snow phenology, which serves as ground truth to verify the performance of snow phenology retrieved by daily cloud-free MODIS NDSI products, thus contributing to the dataset's validation in challenging terrains.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 气象站的观测用于提取地面观测的雪相，作为验证通过每日无云MODIS NDSI产品提取的雪相性能的地面真相，从而有助于在复杂地形中验证数据集的有效性。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What challenges in snow-covered regions affect the application of satellite-derived snow cover data, and how are these challenges addressed?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 在积雪覆盖地区，卫星获取的雪盖数据应用面临哪些挑战，以及如何应对这些挑战？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The extensive cloud cover over snow-covered regions is a critical issue that limits the application of MODIS snow cover products. This challenge is addressed by employing a combination of MOD10A1 and MYD10A1 products and a cloud-gap-filling strategy to generate cloud-free data.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 覆盖在雪覆盖区域的广泛云层是一个关键问题，限制了MODIS雪盖产品的应用。通过结合MOD10A1和MYD10A1产品以及云间隙填补策略来生成无云数据，从而解决了这一挑战。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What are the potential reasons for the observed spatiotemporal variability in snow cover and snow phenology over high mountain regions in Asia?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 高山地区雪盖和雪相的时空变异性观察到的潜在原因是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: The spatiotemporal variability in snow cover and snow phenology over high mountain regions in Asia can be attributed to factors such as climate change, which affects snow cover extent, duration, and timing. Specifically, air temperature during the snow accumulation and melt periods is the dominant factor influencing changes in snow onset and end dates, as well as the duration of snow cover.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 亚洲高山地区雪盖和雪相的时空变异性可以归因于气候变化等因素，这些因素影响雪盖的范围、持续时间和时机。具体而言，雪积累和融化期间的气温是影响雪开始和结束日期以及雪盖持续时间变化的主要因素。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might there be an elevation dependence of snow phenology changes in high-altitude mountain ranges?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 为什么在高海拔山脉中，雪相变化可能存在海拔依赖性？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Elevation dependence in snow phenology changes is likely because high-altitude mountain ranges tend to have a higher snow cover duration (SCD), earlier snow onset dates (SOD), later snow end dates (SED), and longer snow duration days (SDD) compared to lower altitude areas. The variations in temperature and precipitation patterns with elevation significantly impact these snow phenology parameters.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 雪相变化中的海拔依赖性很可能是因为高海拔山脉的雪覆盖持续时间（SCD）较长，雪开始日期（SOD）较早，雪结束日期（SED）较晚，以及雪持续天数（SDD）较长，相较于低海拔地区。海拔高度对温度和降水模式的变化显著影响这些雪相参数。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How would you evaluate the effectiveness of using a cloud-gap-filling strategy in generating daily cloud-free MODIS NDSI products for snow cover analysis in high-altitude regions?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 如何评估在高海拔地区生成每日无云MODIS NDSI产品以进行雪盖分析时使用云缺失填补策略的有效性？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The cloud-gap-filling strategy, combined with the integration of MOD10A1 and MYD10A1 products, has proven effective in generating daily cloud-free MODIS NDSI products. This approach addresses the significant challenge posed by extensive cloud cover in snow-covered regions, thereby improving the monitoring capabilities of snow cover in high-altitude areas.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 云间隙填充策略结合MOD10A1和MYD10A1产品的整合，已被证明在生成每日无云MODIS NDSI产品方面有效。这种方法解决了在雪覆盖区域广泛云层覆盖所带来的重大挑战，从而提高了对高海拔地区雪覆盖监测的能力。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What are the potential challenges you foresee in utilizing MODIS Terra and Aqua daily snow cover products for detecting spatiotemporal variability of snow phenology?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 我预见在利用MODIS Terra和Aqua每日雪盖产品检测雪相变的时空变异性时可能面临的挑战有哪些？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The primary challenges include handling the extensive cloud cover over snow-covered regions, which can limit the use of MODIS products. Additionally, there may be inconsistencies between different study regions, time frames, and scales that complicate understanding snow cover changes. Addressing these challenges requires robust data processing techniques and careful interpretation of results.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 主要挑战包括处理覆盖雪地区的广泛云层，这可能限制MODIS产品的使用。此外，不同研究区域、时间框架和尺度之间可能存在不一致性，这使得理解雪盖变化变得复杂。解决这些挑战需要强大的数据处理技术和对结果的仔细解读。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I don't understand how the cloud-gap-filling strategy is effectively used in generating a reliable daily cloud-free dataset for snow cover analysis.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不明白云间隙填充策略是如何有效用于生成可靠的每日无云数据集，以进行雪盖分析的。
Assertion.AnswerEn: The cloud-gap-filling strategy involves merging MODIS Terra (MOD10A1) and Aqua (MYD10A1) daily snow cover products to create a daily cloud-free MODIS NDSI product from 2002 to 2021. The use of both datasets and interpolation techniques, like the cubic spline interpolation, help in reducing cloud cover impact, enhancing the reliability of the snow cover data.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 云间隙填充策略涉及合并MODIS Terra（MOD10A1）和Aqua（MYD10A1）每日雪盖产品，以创建2002年至2021年的每日无云MODIS NDSI产品。使用这两个数据集和插值技术，如三次样条插值，有助于减少云覆盖的影响，提高雪盖数据的可靠性。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I'm unsure about the process and importance of verifying snow phenology data with ground-truth observations.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我对验证雪相数据与地面观测之间的过程和重要性不太确定。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Ground-truth verification is crucial for ensuring the accuracy of snow phenology data derived from satellite observations. In this domain, daily snow depth observed by 44 meteorological stations from 2002 to 2013 is used as ground truth to validate the snow phenology metrics obtained from the daily cloud-free MODIS NDSI product, which enhances the credibility of the satellite-derived data.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 地面真实验证对于确保从卫星观测中获得的雪相数据的准确性至关重要。在这一领域，使用2002年至2013年间44个气象站观测的每日雪深作为地面真实数据，以验证从每日无云MODIS NDSI产品获得的雪相指标，从而增强卫星衍生数据的可信度。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I can't make sense of how elevation impacts the snow cover duration and other phenology measures in high-altitude regions.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我无法理解海拔如何影响高海拔地区的雪覆盖持续时间和其他物候测量。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Elevation significantly affects snow phenology measures. In high-altitude mountain ranges, snow cover duration (SCD) tends to be longer, with an earlier start of snow cover (SOD) and a later end (SED), resulting in a longer snow duration (SDD) compared to lower altitude areas. This elevation dependence is due to temperature variations and other climatic factors that change with elevation.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 海拔显著影响雪的物候测量。在高海拔山脉中，雪覆盖持续时间（SCD）往往更长，雪覆盖开始时间（SOD）较早，结束时间（SED）较晚，从而导致雪的持续时间（SDD）相比低海拔地区更长。这种海拔依赖性是由于温度变化和其他随海拔变化的气候因素所致。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please describe the data collection techniques used to obtain daily cloud-free snow cover information in high-altitude Asian regions.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请描述用于获取高海拔亚洲地区每日无云雪盖信息的数据收集技术。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: The data collection techniques involve the fusion of MODIS Terra (MOD10A1) and Aqua (MYD10A1) daily snow cover products, employing a cloud-gap-filling strategy with cubic spline interpolation to generate a daily cloud-free MODIS NDSI product for the years 2002 to 2021.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 数据收集技术涉及融合MODIS Terra（MOD10A1）和Aqua（MYD10A1）每日雪盖产品，采用立方样条插值的云缺口填充策略，以生成2002年至2021年的每日无云MODIS NDSI产品。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please analyze the challenges faced in monitoring snow phenology in high-altitude Asian regions using remote sensing data.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 分析在高海拔亚洲地区使用遥感数据监测雪相的挑战。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: The challenges include extensive cloud cover over snow-covered regions, which limits the application of MODIS snow cover products for monitoring. There is also inconsistency in the study region, time frame, and scale, making it difficult to understand changes in snow cover.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 挑战包括在雪覆盖区域的广泛云层，这限制了MODIS雪盖产品的应用。研究区域、时间框架和尺度的不一致性也使得理解雪盖变化变得困难。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please explore potential datasets that can be used alongside MODIS data to enhance the accuracy of snow phenology assessments.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请探索可以与MODIS数据一起使用的潜在数据集，以提高雪相态评估的准确性。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Potential datasets include the daily snow depth (SD) observations from meteorological stations, which can be used to extract ground-observed snow phenology and serve as ground truth to verify the performance of snow phenology retrieved by the daily cloud-free MODIS NDSI product.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 潜在的数据集包括来自气象站的每日雪深（SD）观测，这些观测可以用来提取地面观测的雪相现象，并作为验证每日无云MODIS NDSI产品提取的雪相现象性能的地面真相。
